comment.text:
First, when you walk in... already a vibe. They had the dj playing, smelled great, everything was so pretty and clean. 

My friend and I sat at the bar and the bartenders were so nice! There is an hour and a half seating time at the bar when you get your meal, which isn't too bad. We made it in the time that we had. .. then you gotta move to the patio or a table I believe. 

The food was great! The oxtail was cooked so perfectly. The hummus was great, especially with the roti, I love me some roti. The max and cheese was very cheesy but also had the perfect amount of crab... or lobster... (I can't remember) in it. We also orders oxtail pasta. But after those two appetizers... we were so full. 

The drinks were on point! Definitely coming back here!

Absolutely wonderful brunch!
From the moment you walk in you know you are going to have a great time!
The ambiance is loud and full of life
The decor is fresh, retro and inviting
The wait staff - Briana was informative, fun and made the dining experience exceptional 
The food was delicious 
The presentation on point
Great for large parties
Valet parking
And free parking next door.
Will return

It's the experience and the great food for me. First to note is the entrance is in the rear and they have a parking lot. A prime sign that they want you to spend on the quality of food and service. Secondly, the staff is phenomenal from the first greeting at the door to the bar and table service.  Shout out to Jordan, Tru, Ebony, and DJ Kenneth Style ( Live DJ during brunch).
I enjoyed the Clase Rojas , Little Island Ting, Turkey wings, and the oxtail sandwich on today's outing. The flavors were outstanding.  A perfect complement to the ambiance.
Whether you are a single diner or want to accommodate a group and you're looking for a place to exchange positive energy for a lively experience, Apt 4b is a must for your "go to" spots.

First time here. We had alot of food forgot to take pictures of everything, sorry! 
FOOD: 9/10 for the Jerk chicken with the kale and rice and peas(chicken is spicy, fyi), 5/10 for the oxtail pasta, 8/10 for the Island seafood curry, 7/10 for the crab dip

SERVICE: 7/10 our server was rushing us to order and we only had a party of 5, soo im not sure what the rush was about.

AMBIANCE: 8/10 real chill "apartment like" vibes. hence the name I guess lol. Music was 8/10 around the time we went, which was 7pm-9pm

****SIDENOTE: self parking is $10 and Valet is $15 (what a joke!) and parking is limited. You have to walk up a flight of steps to get to the front door(just fyi) . Also they only you to reverse a table for 2 hours, soo be on time! They DO NOT split the bill! Everything is on 1 ticket.  However, if you want to split the check they ONLY split evenly, and not for what YOU actually ordered(keep that in mind) OVERALL: I will give them a 3.5 stars(which is like a 7.5-8 out of 10)

Food was 10/10. Ordered the fritters, deviled eggs; and the oxtail sandwich with side of macaroni and cheese.

Service: Ask for Paulette. She was attentive and provided great recommendations based off taste buds at the time.

Ambiance: There was a DJ that provided good vibes. Has black art/pictures for decor. Love it!

Parking: Valet is $15.

Came into town to visit family and I met up with a long time friend and Apt 4B was suggested because they have great food and the ambiance is really cute! It was a little confusing finding the restaurant but I realized you have to go down the hill once you enter. Upon arrival we were welcomed with a smile and seated right away. It was pretty clean and just aesthetically pleasing. The waiter really knew that menu and gave us ALL the options! I ordered the Turkey wings with a side of rice & peas and cabbage. The rice and peas was great, you could taste how well they made it. The cabbage was seasoned well. The glaze they coated the Turkey wings were great, I wish it wasn't fried as hard and fell off the bone just a tad bit. I've been craving Turkey wings so it did the job. My friend ordered the oxtail sandwich and upon the first bite he was satisfied! Service was quick and there was no long wait for our food or anything. Literally got us in and out of there. The DJ was playing all types of music which started a vibe in there. Real cute restaurant for sure! Everyone was sweet and welcoming and I would absolutely come back here!! Everything was seasoned well, sad I couldn't try the Mac & cheese since they make it with sharp cheese, but otherwise! Definitely check them out!
Exceptional food, great setting , music and service... Visit once, visit twice, keep it in rotation -- you won't be disappointed.

We celebrated my mom's birthday here as this was her choice of restaurant.
The food was absolutely delicious; however,  there were way too way cons for a return visit to this establishment.
1. You're immediately hit with a mandatory valet parking fee of $15 without the option to self park.

2 THERE IS A 90 MINUTE TABLE LIMIT FROM THE TIME YOU ARE SEATED!!

3. Limited beverage options for non-alcohol drinkers. The options are "flat" water, sparkling water, then straight to wine and liquor!!
No tea, lemonades, or sodas!! 

4. Surcharge for everything!! The jerk chicken came with a huge mound of dry rice and a VERY small side of cabbage. We had to pay an extra $2 for jerk sauce for the rice!!!

5. Some pros: As previously stated, the food was delicious and our server Jordan was excellent!!!

So coming up from South Florida, and looking for a place to have dinner, we found this spot online. The description read that the food was Caribbean and I said why not try. I was curious, on how the Caribbean food was in Atlanta. We first got an appetizer which was the crab dip, that was served with tostones and the grilled glazed octopus, both were very good. The octopus was very tender and combined very well with the cauliflower purée and chimichurri. Both appetizers were delicious. Next, I got the fried Whole snapper. I really like whole fried fish, and in the menu it said it was served with pikliz. When I got my plate I realized it wasn't the Haitian Pikliz, that I was expecting, which is spicy. It was not spicy at all and somethings like fried fish would be great with the traditional Haitian pikliz. The way, I can describe this... it's like ordering chocolate milk without chocolate. I also tried the oxtail stew which was very good. Both entrees came with rice an peas. The flavor of  rice and peas had a hint coconut just the way I like it, like at home. For dessert we got pineapple cake OMG that was the best. I couldn't eat all my food, it was a huge portion but definitely finished the pineapple cake. 

Now let's talk about the ambiance. This place has such an awesome vibe. They have a DJ who played alot of the music, I liked. Downstairs they have a lounge which sounds great to hang out if your spending a visit in Atlanta. Even though the pikliz kind of disappointed me, if I ever come back to Atlanta, I definitely would like to eat here again and try some other dishes.

Loved it! The environment and decor is a vibe - black art everywhere! The food was amazing. I had the seafood curry! And our waiter was sweet. She suggested a good cocktail for me to try (as someone who hates the taste of alcohol). I definitely plan to come again!

And there's mandatory valet!

The food is amazing. I had the Turkey wings and oxtail pasta. Both delicious dishes. The hostess greeted us. The waitress was very informative. My only complaint was for a large group they was only 1 check.

Being hungry on a late Saturday night where there are few places serving real meals can be stressful but now when we have Apt4B. 

Dare I start with dessert after expressing my hunger? The Apple pie-esque dessert was so yummy and a great was to end my Jerk Chicken meal. 
I sat at the bar because I didn't make any reservations on the short notice. The bartenders were very attentive and the DJ did not disappoint. 

I only wish the lamb chops were still on the menu and that there was still an option for self park. But I understand the safety code

Finally made it to APT 4B. This could be my new favorite spot for sure. Did self parking down in the lot instead of valet which was no biggie. Saved 5 bucks. Then took a photo on the cute swing before heading up the stairs for dinner. We arrived at 7 and it was just getting busy. We made it in time for happy hour special where I got 2 great cocktails that were 10 dollars each and they were nice and strong too lol. The oxtail hummus there is to die for. Ordered jerk chicken with rice and peas and kale Delicious! Before leaving we headed to the basement for the hideaway bar so cute! Love it!

photos.caption: Jerk Chicken, Rice and peas with kale

comment.text:
I've always wanted to try this spot and I finally did! We came on a Thursday evening. The main parking lot was full so I parked in the gravel overflow. The only entrance is through the back of the building up some stairs. I met my friend at the bar as they needed the whole party to seat us. The bar has a lot of seating and some ppl elected to sit there the whole night. We moved to a table and I got the 4B reservation martini (also available on the rocks) $16. It was so good and very cute with flowers on the glass. Sting but not too strong. 
We shared the Turkey wing app. 2 large Turkey wings, a little I've cooked and could have used more lemon pepper but still good. I had the vegetable curry which was luscious and a good serving size. My friend had the oxtails which was also large. The ambiance is great, bathrooms clean, service friendly. They charge 20% gratuity automatically no matter party size. I would return.

photos.caption: Kreyol Vegetable Curry (Vegan) with jasmine rice

comment.text:
Dont come here, if you're not a "celebrity." They will treat you like crap!

I was treated poorly and brushed to the side because I wasnt a Real housewives cast member !

My reservation was at the same time as someone else on TV.

I arrived before this person that is on TV and was lied to and made to wait while the person on TV was accommodated FIRST.

My friends watched this with our own eyes as a black owned restaurant treated hard working black customers this way because we werent on tv. Disgusting 

The host and the manager CLIVE were thee absolute worst human beings to be put in a people facing position. In particular Clive, has absolutely no mannetsy, no customer service experience, smug, condescending and very unaccommodating.! Actually, the worst customer service ever. 

If it wasn't a celebration and Saturday evening we would have went somewhere else!

Save your blood pressure and go somewhere else!

Erick was my bartender! He was an absolute joy! He's very attentive, customer service was excellent, and drinks were even better! I'd highly recommend this place!  Whether it's a date with your love or a solo date, Apt. 4B is an entire vibe! You will not be disappointed.

Apt 4B in Atlanta is an exceptional dining experience that left me thoroughly impressed. From the moment I walked into the restaurant, I was greeted with a warm and inviting atmosphere. The chic and contemporary decor, combined with the cozy lighting, create a sophisticated yet relaxed ambiance.

The menu at Apt 4B is a culinary delight. The selection of dishes is diverse and inventive, with a focus on using fresh, locally sourced ingredients. Each dish showcases the creativity and skill of the chefs, resulting in a burst of flavors that tantalize the taste buds.

The attention to detail in every plate is evident, both in the presentation and the taste. From appetizers to desserts, every dish is thoughtfully crafted and beautifully plated. The flavors are bold, yet well-balanced, and the quality of the ingredients shines through.

The service at Apt 4B is top-notch. The staff is friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable about the menu. They are happy to provide recommendations and answer any questions you may have. The level of customer care truly enhances the dining experience.

The bar at Apt 4B deserves a special mention. The handcrafted cocktails are expertly mixed, using high-quality spirits and unique flavor combinations. Whether you prefer a classic cocktail or an innovative creation, the bartenders at Apt 4B have you covered.

The restaurant's location in Atlanta adds to its appeal. Situated in a vibrant neighborhood, it offers a great place to unwind and enjoy a delicious meal after a day of exploring the city.

Overall, Apt 4B is a culinary gem in Atlanta. With its beautiful ambiance, exceptional menu, attentive service, and creative cocktails, it is an experience that is sure to delight food enthusiasts. Whether you're looking for a date night spot or a place to gather with friends, Apt 4B is the perfect choice.

Went here for a girls night. The parking was a little confusing. Just know go all the way down the hill for parking. You'll remember why i said this. 

The ambience was really nice. The DJ was set up around 5:30-6:00pm on a Saturday! Dim lights, open kitchen concept. Very chic. 
We started with the fried oyster mushrooms, cornbread, and Turkey wings. Every thing was good. I honestly would say the fried oyster mushrooms and cornbread were my favorite. This restaurant does 5 courses but you don't have to order in sequence. You can order however you want off the menu. I skipped from course1 appetizers to course 5 and had the oxtail stew. Oxtail was flavorful, tender and fell of the bone served with rice and peas and sautéed vegetables. I would order again. My friend had the jerk chicken and it was okay. I've had better jerk chicken. I also did try their barbecue salmon and it was good with mashed potatoes. 

My biggest complaint: I ordered a to go which was the grilled octopus. I probably should've looked on Yelp for pics before ordering. However this is considered part of their 4th course. I was not expecting an octopus tail with chopped tomatoes. It was so small for the price and looked like it belonged with the course 1 appetizer items. I ordered this with the jasmine rice. It was really disappointing. 

Overall it was nice. I would come again.

I've tried Ms. Iceys so I was very excited to try their sister restaurant! Off the jump, the vibes were amazing! The DJ was playing great tunes throughout our entire duration. 

We had a reservation for Friday night which we were glad we did because it was definitely packed. When we arrived we were seated promptly and tended to immediately. 

I ordered the oxtail pasta, side of plantains, and the Clase Roja which brought my total to about $70 with gratuity included. The oxtail pasta was 10/10 with an ample amount of oxtail--they definitely do not hold out on you. Plantains were sweet and soft, just how I like them and accompanied the pasta greatly. 

I enjoyed the Clase Roja as well! It was a very refreshing drink and it seemed pretty popular as I kept seeing waitresses bring it out to other tables.

Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed my experience and I'm looking forward to coming back!

I've heard about this place but never had the time to actually go. Well I'm glad I decided to give it a try. 

It's not too hard to find but can easily be missed from the main road. Parking is in the back of the building and it's free. Plenty of parking as well as the main lot was full. 

I had reservations but it was too many people in there. Could have gotten seated quickly without one. 

The service was really good and the ambiance was as well. Reminded me of a sleek older record store with all the records on display 

The food came out quick and was very inviting. I definitely recommend the cornbread. I'm a sucker for some good cornbread. 

Overall great experience and will definitely come back to try some the different entrée's.

My coworkers and I visited APT 4B on a Sunday evening before our company's week long annual conference. We wanted to get together as a team one last time before the mayhem started. I had never been here before, but one of my coworkers had and she suggested it.

The Parking: If I'm not mistaken, Self park is $10 and valet is $20. They have a cashapp QR code for you to scan if you don't have cash.

The Atmosphere: Cool BLACK Vibes! Good music too. A good music of Hip-Hop and R&B. Even some Reggae and Afrobeats. Dope Black art on the walls as well. They have a bar, several tables and high tops. 

The Service: The service was Great. Our waitress was super helpful. 

The Food: I wanted the Caesar Salad, but they "ran out". So, I ordered the Island Goddess Salad ($16 - KALE, PAPAYA, AVOCADO, TOASTED CASHEWS,ISLAND GREEN GODDESS DRESSING - WITH JERK CHICKEN ($5)). This salad felt a little dry. Maybe I needed more dressing, but other than that, it was okay. 

In addition, I ordered the Turkey wings ($18 - 2 CONFIT AND FRIED LEMON PEPPER TURKEY WINGS (FLATS)). SLAPPING! HITTING! All that! These are good. They are also super massive! The flavor is BUSSIN!

To drink, I had a Mimosa. I forget what they called it, but it was basically used with Passion Fruit. AMAZING! I had like three of em. 

Overall, I recommend. I'd love to come here during brunch.

photos.caption: Island Goddess Salad with Jerk chicken

comment.text:
I always love coming here because the oxtails hummus and vibes are amazing. I ventured out and tried a few different apps. The cornbread was delicious and the guava butter is exceptional. The curry crabs was good but it is a cold dip and not my favorite. Dessert is always fire!

The energy on a Wednesday was pretty chill. The Dj was awesome and not to loud. We sat at the bar which was not packed. Bartenders were super quick and on top of replenishing drinks with a heavy hand. 

The only part I don't love is after a few drinks those steps to leave are slightly scary but manageable.

Sooo we found this place after reding the recent reviews of another destination and deciding we needed to redirect the uber. To say the building is nondescript is an understatement because it is in the same place as another establishment but once you get inside the vibes are all on high. We had to wait a bit for a table and were seated at a community table even though there were tables outdoors but since it was Friday at 8 pm we figured we should take what we could get. Our server was nice and the host staff even made sure my sis got a birthday shoutout from the DJ. We killed time as we waited on our food with the conversation card game on the table. Food was delicious. Great way to end our time in Atlanta. I would go back and bring others on a return trip.

photos.caption: Shrimp -great flavoring and enough noodles to fill you up
First looks as you walk in-host stand

comment.text:
Apt 4 B review...

I made reservations the night before. Upon arrival we were hit with a $15 valet charge as they said no self parking. I guess, we were in Buckhead. The restaurant itself was nice and a good vibe. Loads of vinyl records were everywhere. Our server Maurice was really nice and very knowledgeable about the drinks and menu. I had their spicy margarita. It was good and had a smoky taste which was different for a drink. We started with the fried oyster mushrooms and turkey wings. Those mushrooms were beyond fantastic! The wings were ok. A bit dry, but the skin was good. For entrees I had the lobster rolls which are technically another appetizer. He had the oxtails. Originally he wanted the jerk chicken but the server said they were pretty spicy and the table next to us confirmed. Honestly, we were so full from the apps we couldn't eat the entrees and took home. We ordered another round of drinks and took them downstairs to the speakeasy lounge, called The Bass Ment. It's a small space but had a nice vibe. Overrall we spent about $300. 20% gratuity included. The food will definitely have us coming back.

It started from Valet to the Host to the Bartenders to our Server! Absolutely Amazing!!!!!!! The vibe is unmatched! I have been to their sister location Ms. Icey's quite a bit; but I can tell you, this experience is unparalleled! The food, service and ambiance is elevated! Now let's get to the food! I had the Turkey wings.......1 million out of 5! Same for the rice and peas! Love love loved! We also had the plantain beignets.  Now don't expect the New Orleans profile of a beignet, but they put a nice Caribbean twist on it! Excellent! The choice in music, amazing!!  Love it! I am a whole fan of this restaurant group that are behind these brilliant restaurant concepts!! It was packed when my girls and i decided to come, and we came close to the switch over from brunch to dinner, and we did not feel rushed at all! Try this place! You won't regret it!

The ox tails were may just write. The drinks were sweet yet strong just like I like my drinks. The atmosphere was soothing. It wasn't that crowded when I went because they had just opened so it was nice.

I wish I could find a complaint. I have none. 
The food was excellent, the service was spot on. The staff treated me like a cousin they hadn't seen in a long time. 
After the food service was done, the DJ was playing some music and the vibes was right.

It was very intimate, and not too crowded. You have to make reservations to get in. I will definitely be back. 

One minor annoyance was when we were ready to leave, the valet was nowhere to be found with the keys. It took the manager some time, but she did find the keys and we were able to get our car and go.

I will be back next time I'm in Atlanta.

So glad so many people told us to go here! It did not disappoint. Went on a Saturday night and the music and vibe were amazing. My only complaint is about the sides. I have really high expectations for places like this. We ordered the jerk chicken and the rice and beans that came with was luke warm and tasteless- the collard greens weren't good either. Truly shocking considering how flawless the corn bread, chicken, and ribs were. The ribs were fall off the bone and all the seasonings/ sauces were delicious. Perfect amount of kick. Would've given 4.5 stars for the disappointing sides but if I have to round it's only fair to round up.

photos.caption: Tamarind Glazed Short Rib Corn bread

comment.text: Possibly my favorite new brunch! Great music, service and fun all while having delicious food. The chef is innovative and made some of the best jerk chicken I've ever had this side of Jamaica. Our waiter was friendly and recommended the Island Mimosas which were a bottomless hit. I would absolutely come back and truly enjoyed this spot.

Food

I had the Grilled and Glaze Octopus. DELICIOUS. Smaller portion as is more of an appetizer. It definitely had s kick to it and if you are not used to cartibean cuisine or jerk seasoning some would say it's spicy. It was a very nice modern take to a traditional cuisine 10/10. 

Devil Eggs were fresh and cool to taste. Worth trying for sure. 

Paloma Margarita - delicious, light, and refreshing. It has a ginger kick to it if you are a ginger lover. Not too sweet, not too sour. 

Ambiance 
Very very cute bar and restaurant. It has Caribbean and hip hop fusion. DJ APEX x Was get food at feeling out the atmosphere and I went on a Tuesday for happy hour and it was bumpin. A lot of afrobeats. I cannot imagine on a weekend how good it must be for party vibes. The restaurant is spacious and well decided between a bar area and table and dinner area for those looking for both vibes in one. Free parking - at least on a Tuesday at 5 pm. 

Service
 Wonderful and attentive. I can tell it was definitely slow but it's Tuesday and I saw quite a bit of traffic. The bartenders were very nice and hostess were attentive. 
was wonderful and attentive.

The whole experience was great. Very cute restaurant. I loved the decor; it felt extremely nostalgic. I had the turkey wings...I absolutely recommend getting them. I also had the jerk chicken meal with peas and rice, and cabbage. Delicious! I also had a drink (I cant remember the name) that had tequila and pomegranate, delicious ! Our server was extremely nice and very knowledgeable of menu and was able to give us recommendations based on our preferences. I went on a Wednesday night and there was a DJ. The vibes were nice and not doing too much. I will definitely be back to try them again. I'm curious about the brunch next!

I've been here a few times now and I feel confident in saying that even when it's crowded (which it usually is) they do a great job of being responsive to their customers and providing great customer service while waiting through being served and given the check. The food and drinks are always top notch. The presentation is everything, the chef came to check in with us, and we were constantly being checked on by our server, Ariel. The ambiance is perfect, music is on point without being too loud to hold a conversation. Highly recommend!!

photos.caption: Red Whole Fried Snapper with plantains and peas and rice

comment.text:
This was my first time dining in at Apt 4B. I was with one other guest and we started with drinks and appetizers. The drinks had barely any liquor and the cornbread was just sweet...bland and cold. The Turkey wings were OK. Then we ordered entrees and before we could eat, the waiter comes over and told us our 1.5 hours of dining was up. We had to box our food to go. 
The food was not as great as the hype and overpriced. Also, the entrees came out less than 5 mins after ordering....side eye.  I guess that is a part of the plan to rush the guests out. A 20-percent gratuity was added for a bill of $185. The added gratuity was indicative of the waiter's service...she clearly did not see any need to do above the bare minimum.
The lack of a great dining experience, for a place with such hype is not sustaining. To be constantly 'checked' on in an effort to speed us up was very noticeable. There was another gentleman that was walking around with an iPad that also kept coming to our table to get us to move along. 
The charges did not match the experience because the food was subpar, the atmosphere was below standard, the music was too loud to have a conversation with the person next to you, and the service was as cold as the food. 
I received the overall best service from Valet and that is an additional $15 charge. 
Avoid this place... Unless you are looking to be underwhelmed and overcharged. It would have been somewhat tolerable if the drinks were at least good and the food wasn't cold and at least had flavor. I have had better tasting food and a larger portion....for less....at a hole-in-the wall.

APT 4b was a whole vibe.
We pulled up to valet parking, I belive was $10 and walked up the steps for our 3pm brunch reservation. We ordered a pitcher o
Casamigos shots were $18 each so I was not happy about that. They also ran out of a number of items we tried to order. But my stuffed French toast was amazing and I tried a piece of the sweet potato waffle yummy.

Note the kitchen closes from 4-5.

Apt 4B is a Caribbean restaurant serving great food and good vibes! 

Food: Delicious! There were a lot of great options on the menu, so at first it was a little hard to choose, until I noticed the lady's plate at the next table. It looked mouth watering (and the waitress said the jerk chicken was really good tonight - I guess that means the right chef was there) so I went with that! I ordered the cornbread appetizer and the Jerk Chicken meal, which comes with kale, rice and peas. She was right, the chicken was REALLY good, and I'm sure it would have been even better if I didn't wait until I was full (and completely done with everything else) to touch it! The cornbread and kale had me in a chokehold, and so did the rice and peas which I dipped in the jerk sauce! And to think, I originally tried to sub those rice & peas for the mashed potatoes (because at most places it can be a bit dry), but I'm glad I didn't. BTW - no substitutions. Order the food the chef has curated. Now, I knew the cornbread would be good because this is the sister restaurant of Ms. Icey's Kitchen and iykyk... but  what I don't know is what in the world they're doing to that kale! I've never in my life had kale that good. 

My friend ordered the short rib with mashed potatoes and we enjoyed that too. 

Atmosphere: It's a vibe! The outside actually does look kind of like an apartment building when you walk up. Inside is decorated with photo frames of Jet Magazine covers, black art, etc. There's a DJ. We were there around 7:30, so we were a little early for the dancing portion, but I think that gets started around 9pm. 

Service: Great! 

Parking: Tonight was valet only, no self parking. $15
That's where it lost a star for me. 

Overall: I loved Apt 4B! If you want a restaurant with good food and a vibe, this is it!

Service is great. From the front to the waiting staff everyone is great and efficient.

The ambiance is great and the restaurant itself is clean and a nice vibe with a live DJ. Be prepared for a $15 charge for valet parking; however, as there is very limited parking in the area.

The food overall is very good. We had the oxtail sandwich, the cornbread, the lobster shrimp and grits, bread pudding (heavy on the rum flavor by the way), and the fried red snapper. Everything is very tasteful, freshly made, and quick to the table. I would recommend this restaurant as a good option for brunch.

Came here for a birthday dinner and everything was great! Down to the food,service,drinks, and ambiance. Everything was so chilled and relaxed. The dj played some really good music. I ordered a lemon drop and it was really good. For food i ordered the jerk chicken, cabbage, and rice & peas. It was a little spicy but overall i give it a 10/10!! I definitely recommend this place if you're looking to wine down and enjoy good food and music. I'll definitely be back!

Ordered the Oxtail Stew, the rice and cabbage had no flavor at all the oxtail didn't either. $48 for a baby portion is ridiculous. The service was okay. I wouldn't recommend anyone to go here. I definitely will not be going back.

I haven't even had dinner yet. But I have to give this place a five star rating. My sister and I needed assistance getting up in the parking lot. They kindly and quickly made arrangements for her to ride the lift. My other sister who has vision issues and mobility issues needed to use the restroom which was downstairs... They made a restroom available to her to accommodate her mobility issues. The bartender. Awesome! Off the chain! He made the best pomegranate margarita and the best Paloma I have ever had! OK it's the first Paloma I ever had but wow it was delicious. Did did a good job making recommendations and otherwise meeting every need. We also enjoyed oxtail hummus. I can't wait to finish up this review. So far so great! I'm here for a party. So I'm going to post again after the party to give a complete opinion. I am loving this joint!

Post dinner update... I am happy to inform you that dinner did not disappoint. Several of us enjoyed the delicious and savory short ribs. What a wonderful jus it was served with! Another friend really enjoyed the fire roasted chicken. My sister loved the oxtail pasta. This evening was excellent all around....ooop!  I forgot to shout out The wonderful hostess. She was so kind and thoughtful all evening. She was concerned about the accommodations that members of our party needed. She was there when we wanted to take a group photo at the end of the evening. She was everywhere and she was on point! I think her name was Ayana but I can't remember. But she knows who she is. In fact even the attendants in the parking lot were awesome. I can't recommend this place highly enough.

Excellent service, excellent food and amazing ambiance. The oxtail hummus was my favorite. The drinks were underwhelming. Highly recommend for the food and ambiance. Oh! And the Turkey wings were also delicious!

Came in on a layover for early Sunday brunch. The space was super inviting with a vibrant and eclectic aesthetic. The DJ was on point mixing 90s jams and your modern day HipHop hits. The food was delicious- from the deviled eggs, plantain beignets, rice and peas and the oxtail sandwich w. coco bread! Looking forward to trying the ackee and salt fish when I return. Staff was friendly, attentive and efficient. Would recommend for brunch, date night, happy hour and events.

Me and my boyfriend came here for dinner on a Friday night. We did make a reservation and ended up being seated in about 5mins after arriving. Ok, so like... this place is CUTE cute! The decor is super eclectic and modern, but with a contemporary black spin and the Jet mag covers to match. There's an adorable bar with OK drinks... I had the Hey Amigo and it was strong but pretty pricey at $22. It's date night so we aren't pinching pennies, but something to note if you intend to come and drink and hang out at the bar. There's a DJ booth in front and the DJ was mixing old and new r&b and soca. YOU LOVE TO SEE IT!!

It's much bigger in the restaurant than I thought upon entering so they can fit a good bit of ppl in here on any given night so we had a ball dancing at our table. You get only 90 mins to eat , so also keep this in mind when you're coming for a date. 

To eat we had oxtail hummus to start, and I've never in my life had oxtail in my hummus but at this point it's absolutely required. Sooo good! For my entree I had griot, which was FANTASTIC! It came with pikliz and green plantains. I don't really care for green plantains so I requested sweet plantains instead but they would not let me swap my side. We ended up just paying for the one I wanted... This is really why it's not 5 stars for me. It's a bit pricey, no prob. But at this price point I'd like the sides I will actually eat with my meal :/ 

Aside from this one thing that may only be a big deal to some/me, I really enjoyed it here! It's a vibe, the music is great, and EVERY SINGLE THING I ATE WAS BOMB.

Classy n relaxy all in one room.  Hey have an impressive whiskey, scotch, bourbon and mezcal collection and unique bar service to match.  

Can't find all the pics but my table had the oxtail hummus that's paired with roti bussup (delish), the cornbread loaf (w/some kinda flavored butter), short ribs, of course the fried snapper along with copius amounts of mezcal shots & margaritas to make you forget the stares when you eat. 

The ONLY concerning thing is there is no accessible entry for elderly or the wheelchair bound. Good thing a member of my party only had a healing broken leg or my birthday dinner would have been a disaster.

photos.caption: Retro decor with a floor TV set and record player in the corner
Tamarind Glazed Short Ribs w/ potato mash

comment.text:
Great food and ambiance. We went for Sunday brunch and if you're a church kid you will appreciate the gospel hits mixed with your favorite beats,

The service is excellent from valet to the waitress and I really appreciate that. Atlanta is full of places with terrible service but this isn't one of them. Also Atlanta has a lot of Caribbean inspired restaurants and they don't always get the flavor right but the food was bomb and steaming hot. I ordered the Oxtail stew and the flavor was there. The rice and peas weren't dry and the portion size matched the price.

The cornbread was fire. My fiancé got the Ackee & Saltfish and it's the best he's had from a restaurant. The drinks were also good.

We already can't wait to come back.

The prices have gone way up and I'm trying to understand the increase....$52 for the Snapper These high tables are and chairs shakey. There are no hooks for your purses under the tables and no where to rest your feet upon the high tables. Very uncomfortable for taller persons.

wanted to do a last minute brunch reservation and APT 4B had space for my party of 4 for the next day. First off the vibe in here was just sooo VIBES. There was a dj that was playing good music (mostly r&b), lots of art work and a swing outside so 10/10 for aesthetic and taking pics. Service was quick & friendly - host sat us right away & waitress was always checking on us and brought us our bill fast. 

As for food: the cornbread they brought out was AMAZING. I got the jerk chicken with rice & peas. It was kinda dry. My 2 friends got the stuffed French toast. One of their french toast was barely stuffed with anything and also she mentioned that it was really oily. My bf got a jerk chicken salad. He said it was good. All the portions were a decent size. 

Overall: great for pics and vibes, food is nothing spectacular. The corn bread is great tho.

Don't sleep on Apt4B. Peeps...believe when I say AMAZING! I was visiting from LA and came here with friends, and boy of boy I can I tell you, the service the Food the vibe....people the vibe was lit AF. I highly recommend this place. I had the Island seafood curry with jasmine rice, cornbread, the turkey wings as an appetizer and for the record cocktail. Baby baby baby baby ......flavor explosion. This Jamaican fusion 10/10. 
Last but not least...our server Maurice  was life. Thank you Chef Miles for gracing us with greatness.
The good was REALLY good. Maybe my new favorite restaurant in Atlanta. The staff was also amazing and provided great customer service and recommendations.

photos.caption: Short rib! So tender and delicious! One entree is enough for two people to share!

comment.text:
Honestly I cannot rave about this place enough. The food was so so good. Literally some of the best food I've ever had. I'm Jamaican so I was deff judging the Caribbean dishes ! From the curry chicken dip to the oxtail pasta omg everything was so good. The drinks were really well made as well. We sat at the bar because seating was very limited. It was a busy night & we didn't have reservations but the staff accommodated us well. The energy & vibes were unmatched. Loved the Afro Caribbean mix. The music was on point. It was just overall a good vibe! 

The only thing I would advise is if you get to go food to check to make sure everything is there. I ordered some extra food to take home & they deff forgot my sides which I didn't notice until after I got home. I will charge that to the fact that they were closing & maybe rushing. Also it was kind of tight in there because it's a little small but overall loved this place

In June 2023 I got the shrimp and grits and Lychee mimosas. Everything was good and service was excellent. I wish they took the tails off the shrimp for dishes like this. Ambiance and music  is perfect.
